intro: Palma spinosa, commonly known as the spiny palm, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to the Canary Islands and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and long, pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by dark blue, fleshy fruits. Palma spinosa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. It plays an important role in the local ecosystem, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
